intro: Leucostemma vestitum, commonly known as the silverleaf beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant features hairy, silver-gray leaves and produces spikes of violet to blue flowers. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. Leucostemma vestitum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
